column4: I'm getting this error when I run fdisk -l: Logical partitions are not in disk order. How do I fix this?
it means your partitions are not "ordered" on the disk
but cfdisk can't even display them. It says they are overlapped.
like for example, sda6 is physically placed before sda5 on the disk
if they are overlapped, it is indeed an error
but it's not the same thing as "nt in logical order"
cfdisk shows this error:  Fatal error: Invalid logical partition 7: increased logical partitions overlapped
but you might have to delete and recreate them
I tried qtparted. It is a bit crazy, the free space of a partition is shown in a different one
you mean I'll have to delete them all?
no, only the ones that overlap
how can I know which ones? This thing is messed up
